contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|caravan|caravans}} '''Caravan''' or '''caravans''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==Transport and travel== ===Specific automobile models=== *[[Dodge Caravan]] *[[Nissan Caravan]] *[[Opel Omega]] Caravan *[[Opel Astra]] Caravan *Chevrolet Caravan ([[GM do Brasil]]) ===Road vehicles intended for human habitation=== *[[Travel trailer]], small trailer in which one can live while travelling, known in Europe and Australasia as a caravan *A "static caravan" is a type of [[mobile home]] *[[Teardrop trailer]], a particular style of travel trailer *[[Recreational vehicle]], used as both a vehicle and temporary travel home ===Aeroplane models=== *[[Cessna Caravan]], a utility aeroplane *[[C-76 Caravan]], an American 1940s medium military transport aircraft ===Types of boat=== *[[Caraboat]], a caravan / speedboat *[[CaraCruiser]], a caravan / speedboat ===Other=== *[[Convoy]], a group of vehicles or ships traveling together for mutual support *[[Caravan Tours]], an escorted tour company *[[Caravan (travellers)]], a group of travellers journeying together *[[Camel train]], a series of camels carrying goods or passengers in a group *[[Wagon train]], a series of wagons, moving together and forming a line * ''[[Caravanim]]'', a trailer-type, pre-fab facility used as a living space, classroom, synagogue, or community centre in Israel ==In literature== * ''[[Caravan (novel)]]'', a 1942 novel by Lady Eleanor Smith * [[Caravan (1975 novel)|''Caravan'' (1975 novel)]], by [[Stephen Goldin]] * [[Caravans (novel)|''Caravans'' (novel)]], James A. Michener * [[Caravan (publishing)]], an Iranian publishing house * "Karawane", a poem by [[Hugo Ball]] * [[Caravan magazine]], a caravan and touring title published by Warners Group * [[Karavan (newspaper)]] published in Kazakhstan ==In film and television== *[[Caravan (1934 film)|''Caravan'' (1934 film)]] *[[Caravan (1946 film)|''Caravan'' (1946 film)]], British drama film starring Stewart Granger *[[Caravan (1971 film)|''Caravan'' (1971 film)]], a Hindi film *[[Caravans (1978 film)|''Caravans'' (1978 film)]], based on the James A. Michener novel *[[Himalaya (film)|''Himalaya'' (film)]], a 1999 Nepalese film also known as ''Caravan'' *[[Caravan Pictures]] a former unit of Buena Vista Motion Pictures Group * [[Caravan (TV series)|''Caravan'' (TV series)]], a Canadian children's television series ==Music and radio== * [[Caravan (song)|"Caravan" (song)]], a 1937 jazz standard * [[Caravan (Van Morrison song)|"Caravan" (Van Morrison song)]], a 1970 song written by Van Morrison * "Caravan", a song by the Inspiral Carpets, from their album ''[[The Beast Inside]]'' * "Caravan", a song by Susumu Hirasawa on the 1995 album ''[[Sim City (album)|Sim City]]'' * [[Caravan (Rush song)|"Caravan" (Rush song)]], a 2010 song by Rush * [[Caravan (Art Blakey album)|''Caravan'' (Art Blakey album)]], 1962 * [[Caravan (Thai band)]], a Thai folk-rock band * [[Caravan (band)]], a Canterbury scene band ** [[Caravan (Caravan album)|''Caravan'' (Caravan album)]], 1968 * ''[[Camel Caravan]]'', radio show sponsored by Camel cigarettes * ''[[Spanish Caravan]]'' a song by [[The Doors]] from their 1968 album ''[[Waiting For The Sun]]'' ==Other== * [[Mudhol Hound|Caravan Hound]], a type of Dog breed * [[Caravanserai]], a roadside inn catering to caravans * Caravan, a strategic card game played in the game ''[[Fallout: New Vegas]]'' {{disambiguation}} [[Category:Persian words and phrases]]
